poem:
"Exit Stage Left, Fred"

In the hum of evening soaps 
ticks the heart of Fred, butcher and bard. 
Amid chatty cash registers,
and over counter meets with corner flirts, 
A broad man compressed within the small screen
as he resided just for a while,
In the kitchen of every UK home;
Now shaded into that quiet yonder, 
where even Fred cannot command the pardon of speech.
